metadata.dc:author: García de Oteyza, G
Álvarez de Toledo, J
metadata.dc:description: CASE REPORT A 20 year-old woman presented with an asymmetric bilateral keratoconus. Cross-linking of the right eye was performed due of its topographic and pachymetric conditions. Three days after the procedure, the patient presented with some corneal infiltrates that where classified as sterile. DISCUSSION Cross-linking is known for its efficacy and safety. Nevertheless, there can be complications. Sterile infiltrates have already been described, although their aetiology is still not clear.

metadata.dc:title: Infiltrados estériles tras cross-linking.
Sterile infiltrates after cross-linking.
